titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

body.p: I baptized Janet Egidia Montgomerie in S. Margaret's. She screamed unflinchingly throughout the service.

Then I attended the Prayer–book Revision Committee at the Church House. The Dean attended & took an effective part. In the afternoon I deserted the Ctee in order to attend the Psycho–therapeutic Ctee in the City. We had Osler present as a witness. He would have nothing to do with clerical & faith healing.

I was pledged to dine with the Canada Club: and Dr Bovey had promised to call for me in his motor. But he failed to keep tryst, a most tremendous thunderstorm which raged from 7 to 7.45 p.m. may have served as an excuse: but I had no dinner!!
Literary earnings stated to the Income Tax Man.
No demand for reduction on account of Curate's stipend as neither Compston nor Westlake is licensed.
